item.title: [LOG4J2-3102] Asynchronous Logger WAITS indefinitely after end of main method
item.description:
When running a Java 8 console application on Linux while a Log4j2 asynchronous logger is configured, the "Log4j2-AsyncAppenderEventDispatcher-1-AsynAppenders" thread remains in a "WAITING (parking)" state even after the end of the application's "main" method is reached.  This prevents the JVM from exiting and the console application from terminating.

This is a NEW issue as of 2.14.1.  Log4j 2.14.0 does not have this problem.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Thanks for the bug report!

It looks like we didn't preserve the `setDaemon(true)` flag in this change:
https://github.com/apache/logging-log4j2/pull/452/files#diff-6b30d73942796a35c3bcf93d46127d03cb6959fb69fb8eb84c4c6fca13bb68e6L390

I should be able to fix it up shortly.

Commit b9a6ccd02ca7b02ed96f342e11c3c422b7bd7c29 in logging-log4j2's branch refs/heads/release-2.x from Carter Kozak
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=logging-log4j2.git;h=b9a6ccd ]

Commit e24e2e8901ccfff1b7e6c5b8d40b707bfc91c843 in logging-log4j2's branch refs/heads/master from Carter Kozak
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=logging-log4j2.git;h=e24e2e8 ]

LOG4J2-3102: AsyncAppender background thread is a daemon
I've committed the fix to release-2.x in preparation for the 2.15.0 release, as well as master. Please verify using a snapshot build and close the ticket if you can verify the issue is resolved.

[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=logging-log4j2.git;h=b9a6ccd ]

LOG4J2-3102: AsyncAppender background thread is a daemon

I tested the fix using Log4j 2.15.0-SNAPSHOT (from https://repository.apache.org/snapshots) and I have confirmed that the issue is resolved.  Asynchronous loggers no longer block the termination of the JVM. Thank you for the resolution!
